description: A composite that allows its content to overflow either vertically (default) or horizontally. Since the ScrollView does not compute its own size, the width and height must be defined by the respective layout properties (e.g. either `width` or `left` and `right` must be specified).

direction.description: Specifies the scrolling direction of the scroll composite.

offsetX.description: The horizontal scrolling position in dip.

offsetY.description: The vertical scrolling position in dip.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to scroll to in dip.

scrollToX.description: Scrolls to the given horizontal offset using an animation. Has no effect on a vertical `ScrollView`

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset to scroll to in dip.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An additional object to control the animation. Set `{animate: false}` to scroll without an animation.

scrollToX.description: Scrolls to the given horizontal offset. Give `{animate: false}` as the second parameter to suppress the animation.

parameters.name: offsetY
parameters.description: The offset to scroll to in dip.

scrollToY.description: Scrolls to the given vertical offset using an animation. Has no effect on a horizontal `ScrollView`

parameters.name: offsetY
parameters.description: The offset to scroll to in dip.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An additional object to control the animation. Set `{animate: false}` to scroll without an animation.

scrollToY.description: Scrolls to the given vertical offset. Give `{animate: false}` as the second parameter to suppress the animation.

offset.description: Indicates the current horizontal scrolling position.
Indicates the current vertical scrolling position.
